title.narrative: EBRD Trust Fund Moldova Residential Energy Efficiency Finance Facility (MoREEFF)
Trust Fund EBRD för energieffektivisering i bostäder, Energy Facility (MoREEFF)

description.narrative: Aims to improve energy efficiency invetments in the residential sector by increasing awareness on saving potentials and access to soft credits from local banks. Financed in cooperation with EU/NIF and EBRD which implements and provides a credit line to the local banks.

Projektet syftar till ökade investeringar i energieffektivisering i bostäder genom ökad kunskap om besparingsmöjligheter samt tillgång till subventioner av lån från lokala banker. Genomförs i samarbete med EU (NIF) och EBRD som implementerar och tillhandahåller en lånegaranti till de lokala bankerna.

participating-org.narrative: EBRD/European Bank for Reconstruction and Development
EBRD/European Bank for Reconstruction and Development

policy-marker.narrative: Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention on Biological Diversity
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention to Combat Desertification
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Adaptation
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Mitigation
Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

description.narrative: The MoREEFF financed projects help save over 17,100 MWh per year, which is enough energy to heat water for over 850,000,000 cups of tea or enough to drive a car over 25,500,000 kilometres. They bring reduction in CO2 emissions of over 3,200 tonnes per year, which is equivalent to the amount of CO2 annually absorbed by a forest of 118,000 trees. PFIs efforts to promote MoREEFF loan products across the country brought about long lasting economic benefits from sustainable energy investments reaching out to many rural and urban areas in Moldova. Sustainable energy benefits have reached thousands of households across the country, which is the single most important result that the MoREEFF programme has achieved. When it comes to economic benefits, the most obvious of those has to be in terms of reduced energy use and as a result, lower bills to householders for many years ahead; and on macro level - improved balance of payment for Moldova, less dependence on imported energy and enhanced security of supply. In this respect, at least from the perspective of individual households and direct economic benefits, MoREEFF sustainability is easily measured through the amount of MWh/year electricity equivalents saved. The economic benefits for local suppliers and retailers have been significant, with a positive impact on local employment too. This has been most pronounced outside the largest cities, but in urban areas too. The MoREEFF programme has seen significant spin-off benefits to local eligible equipment suppliers and installers who developed long standing relationships with the PFIs. The vigorous enforcement of the stringent energy efficiency requirements of the MoREEFF facility has continued the process of raising the awareness of the households, pushed for better customer service and improved craftsmanship provided by the local suppliers and installers.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
